ygData.subject: Re: New Lullaby theory
ygData.msgSnippet: This makes a heck of a lot of sense.  Lullaby used to work a LOT better for me at level 15, even against level 1 mobs than it does now that I m 35th ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
This makes a heck of a lot of sense. Lullaby used to work a LOT better for
me at level 15, even against level 1 mobs than it does now that I'm 35th
----- Original Message -----
From: <kim@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, February 22, 2000 5:15 PM
Subject: [eqbards] New Lullaby theory


> From: kim@...
>
> This theory came up on the concert hall board. A bard there
> claimed to have used Lullaby with great success in Runnyeye.
>
> Anyways, my new theory is that somewhere in the resist check
> when GZ should've used the mob's level, he accidently used the
> bard's level. So if you (the bard) are relatively low level,
> the song works reasonably well against even con mobs. But if
> you are high level, the minimum resist rate is that of a high
> level mob.
>
> It has a lot of holes, but it warrants checking out. So if
> you are L15-25 or so, could you try logging some of your
> Lullaby episodes? If I remember, Kitasi is about the right
> level for Runnyeye, no? :) You can pull out the data
> yourself, or email the logfile to me and I'll do it.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
>
>
